etymology.description: 不(不) (bù, "not") and 改(改) (gǎi, "change") come together to mean "not change."
etymology.interpretation: This combination of 不(不) (bù, "not") and 改(改) (gǎi, "change") directly expresses the concept of retaining the current state or refusing alterations.

examples.chinese: 尽管世界变化万千(儘管世界變化萬千)，内心情怀不改(內心情懷不改)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn shìjiè biànhuà wànqiān, nèixīn qínghuái bù gǎi.
examples.english: Although the world changes in myriad ways, the inner sentiments remain unaltered.

examples.chinese: 面对挑战(面對挑戰)，他信念不改(他信念不改)。
examples.pinyin: Miànduì tiǎozhàn, tā xìnniàn bù gǎi.
examples.english: Facing challenges, his conviction remains unchanged.

examples.chinese: 在岁月流逝中(在歲月流逝中)，我们的理想不改(我們的理想不改)。
examples.pinyin: Zài suìyuè liúshì zhōng, wǒmen de lǐxiǎng bù gǎi.
examples.english: Amid the passage of time, our ideals remain unaltered.
